def Web_scraping(page):
    baselink='https://tiki.vn/search?q=adidas&sort=top_seller&page=' #the link of Adidas products on Tiki
    list_of_names=[]
    list_of_prices=[]
    list_of_discounts=[]
    list_of_urls_new=[]
    for i in range(page): #add the page argument in the function to get the numbers of page to get the data
        html=urlopen(baselink+str(i)) 
        bs = BeautifulSoup(html.read(), 'html.parser') 

        product_names=bs.find_all('div', attrs={"class":"name"}) # products_name will be as a dictionary with the keys and values

        
        for product in product_names:
            name=product.find('span').text
            list_of_names.append(name) 


        product_prices=bs.find_all('div', attrs={"class":"price-discount__price"})
        
        for element in product_prices:
            price=element.text
            list_of_prices.append(price)
 
        
        price_discounts=bs.find_all('div', attrs={"class":"price-discount"})
        for element in price_discounts:
            if element.find('div', attrs={"class":"price-discount__discount"})==None:
                list_of_discounts.append("-0%")
            else:
                discount=element.find('div', attrs={"class":"price-discount__discount"}).text
                list_of_discounts.append(discount)
        
        site='https://tiki.vn'
        list_of_urls=[]
        
        urls=bs.find_all('a', attrs={'class':'product-item'})    
        for url in urls:
            list_of_urls.append(url['href']) 
        for url in list_of_urls:    
            urlnew='{}{}'.format(site, url)
            list_of_urls_new.append(urlnew)
        #create a dictionary to make a dataFrame
        dict_pro={"Name of product":list_of_names, "Price": list_of_prices, "Discount": list_of_discounts, "Link": list_of_urls_new}
    return dict_pro
